= names =

== Syntax ==
 field: '''.names''' (Read/Write)

== Description ==
The '''names''' field returns a stringlist containing all names that match a unit. This field provides access to the complete list of names and keywords that can be used to identify or reference a unit, allowing for multiple aliases and alternative names.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Access !! Type !! Description
|-
| Read || stringlist || Returns list of all names for the unit
|-
| Write || stringlist || Can modify the names list (add/remove names)
|}

== Availability ==
This field is available on the following unit types:
* UNIT_ST_PC (Player Character)
* UNIT_ST_NPC (Non-Player Character)
* UNIT_ST_OBJ (Object)
* UNIT_ST_ROOM (Room)
* extraptr (Extra description pointer)

== Examples ==
 dilbegin identify_item(item : unitptr);
 var
    all_names : stringlist;
    name_count : integer;
    i : integer;
 code
 {
    if (item.type != UNIT_ST_OBJ)
    {
       exec("say That's not an object!", self);
       return;
    }
    
    all_names := item.names;
    name_count := length(all_names);
    
    exec("say This item has " + itoa(name_count) + " names:", self);
    
    // Loop through all names
    i := 0;
    while (i < name_count)
    {
       exec("say Name " + itoa(i) + ": " + all_names.[i], self);
       i := i + 1;
    }
 } dilend

 dilbegin check_weapon_names(weapon : unitptr);
 var
    weapon_names : stringlist;
 code
 {
    weapon_names := weapon.names;
    
    // Check if it has specific weapon names
    if ("sword" in weapon_names)
    {
       exec("say This is a sword-type weapon.", self);
    }
    else if ("axe" in weapon_names)
    {
       exec("say This is an axe-type weapon.", self);
    }
    else if ("mace" in weapon_names)
    {
       exec("say This is a mace-type weapon.", self);
    }
    else
    {
       exec("say Unknown weapon type.", self);
    }
 } dilend

 dilbegin modify_npc_names(npc : unitptr);
 var
    current_names : stringlist;
 code
 {
    current_names := npc.names;
    
    // Add a new alias to the NPC
    addstring(current_names, "guard");
    addstring(current_names, "warrior");
    
    exec("say NPC now has additional names.", self);
    
    // Show all names
    exec("say All names: " + current_names.[0], self);
    exec("say All names: " + current_names.[1], self);
    exec("say All names: " + current_names.[2], self);
 } dilend

 dilbegin extra_description_check(extra : extraptr);
 var
    extra_names : stringlist;
    name_count : integer;
    i : integer;
 code
 {
    extra_names := extra.names;
    name_count := length(extra_names);
    
    exec("say This extra has " + itoa(name_count) + " names:", self);
    
    // Display all names for the extra description
    i := 0;
    while (i < name_count)
    {
       exec("say Keyword " + itoa(i) + ": " + extra_names.[i], self);
       i := i + 1;
    }
 } dilend

 dilbegin name_search_test(target : unitptr);
 var
    all_names : stringlist;
    search_name : string;
 code
 {
    all_names := target.names;
    search_name := "special_item";
    
    // Check if the target has a specific name
    if (search_name in all_names)
    {
       exec("say Found the special item!", self);
       exec("say It's also known as: " + target.name, self);
    }
    else
    {
       exec("say This is not the special item.", self);
       exec("say Its names are: " + all_names.[0], self);
    }
 } dilend

 dilbegin room_exit_check(room : unitptr);
 var
    exit_names : stringlist;
    i : integer;
 code
 {
    if (room.type != UNIT_ST_ROOM)
    {
       exec("say That's not a room!", self);
       return;
    }
    
    exit_names := room.exit_names;
    
    // Check all exit directions for names
    i := 0;
    while (i < length(exit_names))
    {
       exec("say Exit " + itoa(i) + " names: " + exit_names.[i], self);
       i := i + 1;
    }
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The '''names''' field provides read/write access to the complete name list
* The first name in the list (index 0) is typically the primary name used by [[name]] field
* Names can be accessed by index using array notation: `unit.names.[index]`
* Common uses include:
** Multiple aliases for NPCs and objects
** Keyword matching for extra descriptions
** Exit names for rooms
** Weapon type identification
* Use [[addstring]] and [[remove]] functions to modify the names list
* Use [[length]] function to get the number of names
* Use the '''in''' operator to check if a specific name exists in the list

== Error Handling ==
* Returns '''fail''' if unit pointer is null or invalid
* Returns '''error''' if accessed on an unsupported unit type
* Index out of bounds when accessing names.[index] will cause runtime errors
* Always validate the unit type before accessing the names field

== Related Functions/Fields ==
* [[name]] - Primary name field (first name in names list)
* [[addstring]] - Add a name to the names list
* [[remove]] - Remove a name from the names list
* [[insert]] - Insert a name at specific position
* [[length]] - Get number of names in the list
* [[substring]] - Extract part of a name string
* [[in]] - Check if name exists in the names list
